intro: Hyalopoa lakia, commonly known as the Lakia mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are typically pale green to white, with yellow central disks, and bloom during the rainy season. Hyalopoa lakia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
